head.supplied: Melbourne botanic & zoologic Garden, ¶ 27. Nov. 1860. ¶ Sir ¶ ¶ I have the honor to solicit, that you will be pleased to permit the printing at the Governments Printing Office of a short report on th...

div.p: Q60/10762, unit 748, VPRS 1189/P inward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.
Se also M to W. Nicholson, 7 November 1860. Melbourne botanic & zoologic Garden,

I have the honor to solicit, that you will be pleased to permit the printing at the Governments Printing Office of a short report on the plants collected during the recent Burdekin Expedition & transmitted to this Office for examination by the Queensland Government.
B60.13.12. I further beg to solicit, that you will be pleased to sanction the printing of 100 extra copies, of which I am anxious to forward 50 to the Queensland Government & 50 to scientific institutions in various parts of the globe

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: I have the honor to be,

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p:
&c&c&c
On 30 November 1860 the Under Secretary, J. Moore, instructed: 'The Govt Printer will be so good as to print this Report and supply Dr Mueller with the number of Copies he requires'. The Government Printer, J. Ferres replied on 4 December: 'Printed and supplied'.
